sections.title: Create Your BBB Business Profile
sections.content:
The Better Business Bureau has been helping consumers find trustworthy businesses since 1912. A BBB profile provides credibility and can significantly impact customer decision-making, with 73% of consumers saying they're more likely to choose a business with BBB accreditation.

Getting Started with BBB:

  1. Visit your local BBB website (find yours at bbb.org)
  2. Search for your business to see if a profile already exists
  3. If found, claim your existing profile; if not, start a new business profile
  4. Complete the online business profile form with accurate information
  5. Provide all required business documentation and verification

Essential Business Information:

  • Business Name: Official legal name and any DBAs (Doing Business As)
  • Business Address: Physical location where business operates
  • Contact Information: Phone, email, and website
  • Business Type: Corporation, LLC, Partnership, Sole Proprietorship
  • Industry Category: Specific industry classification
  • Years in Business: When the company was established
  • Number of Employees: Current workforce size

Required Documentation:

  • Business license or registration certificate
  • Articles of incorporation or business formation documents
  • Professional licenses relevant to your industry
  • Insurance certificates (liability, professional, etc.)
  • Tax identification numbers

Profile Benefits:

  • Increased customer trust and credibility
  • Higher conversion rates from potential customers
  • Improved local search rankings
  • Protection against unfair competition
  • Access to BBB dispute resolution services
tips: Gather all required documents before starting the application to avoid delays
Ensure your business information matches across all official documents
Complete every section of the profile for maximum credibility impact

sections.title: Navigate the BBB Accreditation Process
sections.content:
BBB Accreditation is a premium service that provides additional benefits and demonstrates your commitment to ethical business practices:

Accreditation Requirements:

  • Business Longevity: Must be in business for at least 6 months (varies by region)
  • Proper Licensing: All required business licenses must be current
  • Responsive to Complaints: Must respond to BBB complaints in a timely manner
  • Honest Advertising: Marketing materials must be truthful and substantiated
  • Transparent Business Practices: Clear policies on pricing, refunds, and service delivery
  • No Unresolved BBB Complaints: Outstanding complaints must be resolved

Application Process:

  1. Complete the detailed accreditation application
  2. Pay the annual accreditation fee (varies by business size and location)
  3. Provide comprehensive business information and documentation
  4. Submit advertising and marketing materials for review
  5. Undergo background checks on business principals
  6. Wait for BBB review and approval (typically 2-4 weeks)

Accreditation Fees:

  • Fees range from $200-$10,000+ annually based on business size
  • Calculated using number of employees and annual revenue
  • Some regions use different fee structures
  • Payment plans may be available for larger fees

Standards for Accreditation:

  • Build Trust: Be trustworthy in all business dealings
  • Advertise Honestly: Be truthful in advertising and marketing
  • Tell the Truth: Be honest about products, services, and pricing
  • Be Responsive: Address customer concerns promptly and professionally
  • Safeguard Privacy: Protect customer information and privacy
  • Embody Integrity: Conduct business with integrity and respect
tips: Start the accreditation process early - it can take several weeks to complete
Review all marketing materials to ensure they meet BBB advertising standards
Establish clear customer service processes before applying for accreditation

sections.title: Manage Your BBB Rating and Online Reputation
sections.content:
Your BBB rating is based on 16 different factors and significantly influences customer trust. Understanding and managing these factors is crucial for maintaining a high rating:

BBB Rating Factors:

  • Complaint History: Number and nature of complaints filed with BBB
  • Complaint Resolution: How quickly and satisfactorily complaints are resolved
  • Time in Business: Length of time the business has been operating
  • Business Size: Size of business relative to complaint volume
  • Licensing and Government Actions: Compliance with industry regulations
  • Advertising Issues: Problems with advertising claims or practices
  • Transparency: Willingness to provide requested information to BBB

Rating Scale Understanding:

  • A+ (Excellent): Highest rating, demonstrates exceptional business practices
  • A to A-: Very good to excellent performance
  • B+ to B-: Good performance with minor issues
  • C+ to C-: Fair performance, some concern areas
  • D+ to D-: Poor performance, significant issues
  • F (Failing): Serious problems, consumer warning issued

Complaint Management Strategy:

  • Respond to all BBB complaints within 14 days
  • Provide detailed, professional responses
  • Offer fair solutions that address customer concerns
  • Follow through on commitments made in responses
  • Use complaints as opportunities to improve business practices

Proactive Reputation Management:

  • Monitor your BBB profile regularly for new complaints or changes
  • Address issues before they become formal complaints
  • Train customer service staff on BBB complaint procedures
  • Create internal processes for handling customer disputes
  • Document all customer interactions and resolutions
tips: Set up email alerts for new BBB complaints to ensure quick response times
Create standard operating procedures for handling different types of complaints
View complaints as feedback to improve your business operations

sections.title: Encourage and Manage Customer Reviews
sections.content:
Customer reviews on your BBB profile provide social proof and influence potential customers' decisions. Here's how to build a strong review profile:

Review Generation Strategies:

  • Post-Purchase Follow-up: Send follow-up emails asking satisfied customers to review
  • In-Person Requests: Ask happy customers in person to leave reviews
  • Service Completion: Request reviews immediately after successful service delivery
  • Email Signatures: Include BBB review links in staff email signatures
  • Business Cards: Add QR codes linking to your BBB review page

Review Best Practices:

  • Focus on getting reviews from your best customers first
  • Make it easy by providing direct links to your review page
  • Time requests when customer satisfaction is at its peak
  • Be specific about the value of their feedback
  • Never incentivize reviews or offer compensation

Responding to Reviews:

  • Positive Reviews: Thank customers and highlight specific points they mentioned
  • Negative Reviews: Respond professionally and offer to resolve issues offline
  • Neutral Reviews: Acknowledge feedback and invite further discussion
  • Response Timing: Aim to respond within 24-48 hours
  • Professional Tone: Maintain a helpful, non-defensive tone in all responses

Using Reviews for Business Improvement:

  • Analyze review patterns to identify service improvement opportunities
  • Address commonly mentioned issues in business operations
  • Use positive feedback to train staff on what customers value most
  • Share positive reviews with team members to boost morale
  • Create case studies from detailed positive reviews

Review Marketing Integration:

  • Feature positive BBB reviews on your website and marketing materials
  • Include review excerpts in social media posts
  • Use reviews in sales presentations and proposals
  • Share reviews in email newsletters and customer communications
  • Include review statistics in your marketing metrics
tips: Never ask customers to change or remove negative reviews - focus on resolution
Use review insights to improve your products, services, and customer experience
Celebrate positive reviews with your team to reinforce good customer service

sections.title: Leverage BBB Accreditation in Your Marketing
sections.content:
BBB Accreditation is a powerful marketing tool that can differentiate your business and build immediate trust with potential customers:

Marketing Materials Integration:

  • Website: Display BBB logo prominently on homepage and contact pages
  • Business Cards: Include BBB accreditation and rating
  • Email Signatures: Add BBB logo and link to your profile
  • Advertising: Include BBB accreditation in print and digital ads
  • Storefront: Display BBB window cling or certificate
  • Proposals: Include BBB accreditation in business proposals and bids

Digital Marketing Applications:

  • Add BBB schema markup to your website for rich snippets
  • Include BBB rating in Google My Business description
  • Feature BBB accreditation in social media profiles
  • Create content around your commitment to ethical business practices
  • Use BBB rating in paid advertising copy

Sales and Customer Conversion:

  • Train sales team to mention BBB accreditation during customer interactions
  • Use BBB rating to address customer concerns about trust and reliability
  • Include BBB information in follow-up communications with prospects
  • Leverage BBB accreditation to justify premium pricing
  • Use BBB standards as talking points about quality and service

Competitive Advantages:

  • Trust Factor: 73% of consumers more likely to choose BBB-accredited businesses
  • Differentiation: Stand out from non-accredited competitors
  • Premium Positioning: Position your business as higher quality
  • Customer Confidence: Reduce customer anxiety about choosing your business
  • Referral Boost: Customers more likely to refer accredited businesses

Industry-Specific Applications:

  • Home Services: Essential for contractors, plumbers, HVAC companies
  • Financial Services: Critical for tax preparers, financial advisors, insurance agents
  • Healthcare: Important for alternative medicine, wellness centers
  • Retail: Valuable for e-commerce and high-ticket item sales
  • Professional Services: Beneficial for consultants, lawyers, accountants
tips: Always use current BBB logos and follow their brand guidelines
Update marketing materials immediately if your rating changes
Track the impact of BBB accreditation on your conversion rates and customer acquisition

sections.title: Maintain Your BBB Profile and Accreditation Status
sections.content:
Maintaining your BBB profile and accreditation requires ongoing attention and commitment to ethical business practices:

Annual Renewal Process:

  • Review and pay annual accreditation fees by the due date
  • Update business information and documentation as needed
  • Confirm all licensing and insurance information is current
  • Review and update advertising materials for compliance
  • Complete any required continuing education or certification

Ongoing Monitoring Tasks:

  • Weekly: Check for new complaints or customer inquiries
  • Monthly: Review rating and profile for any changes
  • Quarterly: Update business information and photos
  • Annually: Complete accreditation renewal and comprehensive review

Compliance Management:

  • Ensure all advertising continues to meet BBB standards
  • Maintain proper licensing for all business activities
  • Keep insurance coverage current and adequate
  • Document business practices and policy updates
  • Train staff on BBB standards and complaint procedures

Performance Improvement:

  • Analyze complaint patterns to identify improvement opportunities
  • Implement system changes to prevent common issues
  • Update policies and procedures based on customer feedback
  • Invest in staff training to improve customer service
  • Monitor competitor BBB profiles for best practices

Crisis Management:

  • Develop procedures for handling serious complaints or negative publicity
  • Create rapid response protocols for urgent issues
  • Establish communication plans for stakeholders during crises
  • Document lessons learned from difficult situations
  • Build relationships with BBB staff for guidance during challenges

Long-Term Strategy:

  • Set goals for maintaining or improving your BBB rating
  • Plan investments in business improvements that support high ratings
  • Develop metrics to track the ROI of BBB accreditation
  • Create systems that scale as your business grows
  • Stay informed about changes to BBB standards and requirements
tips: Set calendar reminders for all BBB-related deadlines and renewal dates
Create internal metrics that align with BBB rating factors
View BBB maintenance as an investment in long-term business credibility
